intro: Psychotria paludicola, commonly known as the swamp psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in swampy or boggy areas. Psychotria paludicola is also known for its chemical compounds, some of which have been studied for potential pharmacological applications.
